headline: Why Walmart Stock Was Sliding Today
summary: Shares of Walmart (NYSE: WMT) were pulling back today along with a broader slide in the retail sector, after the Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index fell to a four-year-low, with future expectations hitting a 12-year low, according to the Conference Board.  As the country's and the world's biggest retailer, Walmart has arguably more exposure to consumer spending than any other company, though its reputation for low prices may make it better positioned than some other retailers to weather a recession.  As of 2:07 p.m. ET, Walmart stock was down 2.9% on the news.

headline: The Pets Table Launches At Walmart (NYSE:WMT) With Flat 7 Day Share Price Move
summary: The Pets Table has launched its minimally-processed air-dried dog food at Walmart (NYSE:WMT), marking its first in-store retail distribution. This new product availability could align with Walmart's minor 0.03% share price change over the past week, especially as major indices like the S&P 500 and Nasdaq saw slight increases while the Dow Jones was flat. Despite these small movements, the overall retail sector is seeing positive developments. While external factors like market recoveries from...

headline: Tariffs weigh on consumers: What CEOs are saying
summary: One of the things that has consumers on edge is tariffs. Those same concerns are weighing on CEOs, too. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma takes a closer look at what executives at some of the biggest consumer companies are saying about the levies. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.

headline: Amazon Primary Care Is Coming To A Town Near You. E-Commerce Giant Steps Up Healthcare Chain Rollout
summary: Where Walgreens and Walmart (NYSE:WMT) failed, Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) aims to succeed. As Americans age, primary healthcare has become an increasingly important target for retailers. However, it has proven elusive to conquer. According to CoStar News, Amazon is trying a different approach. By partnering with hospital chains and offering care to its Prime members — currently with an additional cost — it hopes to succeed where others have not.
